page.title: 19WOMEN'S INSTITUTE. SCALES.
page.content: Scales Women's Institute was formed on 6th May 1942. There are 30 members including three who were involved in the foundation meeting. The ladies come from Newbiggin,Baycliff,Gleaston, Stainton and, Scales where the monthly meetings are held in the Malt Kiln. Speakers are invited to give talks and interests include, golf,walking,lace- making,gardening,upholstery,paper sculpture,collecting antiques,bee- keeping,glass engraving,flower displays, and voluntary work in the local hospitals and with the elderly. In conjunction with other W.I's in the area, a Michaelmas Fair, to be held in October 1985 is being organised. Mrs Porter represented Scales and Urswick at the A.G.M. of the N.F.W.I. in the Royal Albert Hall,London this year.Three members attended courses at Denmead College,Berkshire also.
